intro: Leunisia laeta, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight hairy texture. Leunisia laeta is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
